item.title: Version 2.0.0
item.description:
NameQuick v2.0.0

This one’s big. I rebuilt a lot of NameQuick so it feels simpler, steadier, and more predictable. You should notice it right away.

What’s New

  • UI that gets out of your way: clearer navigation, fewer clicks, smarter defaults.
  • Results you can trust: better validation and error handling means fewer hiccups and do‑overs.
  • Stays smooth under load: long sessions are calmer with fewer surprises.
  • Subscription customers should see a significant boost in reliability and consistency in the template feature.
  • BYOK + GPT‑5: if you bring your own key, the model picker now includes GPT‑5 and a new “Reasoning Effort” dropdown. Start low, then bump it up to balance speed, cost, and quality.

Templates

  • More breathing room and an editor that’s easier to set up.
  • Iterating is faster, and outputs are more consistent.
  • I’ll keep polishing this area - expect steady improvements.

Looking Ahead

  • With the heavy lift done, I can ship faster, smaller updates.
  • Public roadmap is back: vote or suggest ideas at https://namequick.featurebase.app/roadmap
  • I’m also investing in better reliability for local models (they’re tight on typical hardware, so this will land in steps).

Feedback

  • Easiest path: email support from Settings → About (add “Feedback” to the subject).
  • Helpful details: your NameQuick version, macOS version, what you expected vs. what happened, and a small sample template/output if you can.

Thank You

Thanks for sticking with me through this one. Your patience and feedback made 2.0 possible.

— Josef
